abstract: Gov Andrew M Cuomo administration quietly suspends plan to require background checks on sale of ammunition in New York State, provision that was part of state's Safe Act gun control measures passed in 2013; suspension is result of deal between Cuomo and State Senate's Republican majority, and has been criticized by Democratic minority and State Assembly Speaker Carl E Heastie.
lead_paragraph: The background checks on ammunition were a key part of the Safe Act, the set of tough gun control measures that Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo persuaded lawmakers to pass in January 2013.

headline.main: Plan to Require Background Checks for Ammunition Sales Is Suspended in New York
headline.print_headline: Plan to Require Background Checks for Ammunition Sales Is Suspended

snippet: The background checks on ammunition were a key part of the Safe Act, the set of tough gun control measures that Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo persuaded lawmakers to pass in January 2013.
